page.title: 17LIFE OF SHROTON CHILDREN
page.content: SHROTON CHILDREN HAVE TO BE UP EARLY TO WAIT AT THE POST OFFICE FOR THE SCHOOL BUS TO TAKE THEM TO FONTMELL MAGNA OR SHAFTESBURY AND THEY ARE AWAY UNTIL LATE IN THE AFTERNOON. THE FIVE YEAR OLDS IN PARTICULAR FIND IT A LONG TIRING DAY.TO OUTSIDERS THESE CHILDREN SEEM LUCKY BECAUSE THEY HAVE SPACE AND BEAUTIFUL COUNTRYSIDE IN WHICH TO PLAY BUT THERE IS NOTHING SPECIFICALLY PROVIDED FOR THEM. THEY WOULD LIKE A PLAYGROUND WITH SWINGS AND SPORTS FACILITIES. TEENAGERS SAY THAT ALL THE ACTIVITIES ARE FOR OLDER PEOPLE AND THEY FIND THE VILLAGE DULL. THEY KNOW THERE IS LITTLE CHANCE OF FINDING JOBS HERE AND ON MOST EVENINGS A GROUP OF BORED YOUNG PEOPLE CAN BE FOUND IN THE BUS SHELTER OPPOSITE THE PUB. THEY SMOKE AND LISTEN TO THE RADIO TO PASS THE TIME. A FEW CHILDREN ARE AWAY AT BOARDING SCHOOL.
